title: Rubberbanding?
body:
the last couple games i've played i've experienced an annoying event where my champion will bounce around the screen, gameplay wise everything else seems unaffected, abilities seem to work just fine and there is no lag in terms of dealing with other player, the only issue seems to be i cannot properly allocate the location of my champion because of this strange rubberbanding effect. this makes it difficult to escape and engage teamfights, i cant properly take objectives, and its just annoying to look at. 

the game says my ping is 30-60 and my fps is 400-1000???

please if this is something i can fix on my end let me know. i've tried resetting routers, checking graphics cards, running virus scans, upgrading my internet, yet none of it seems to work. 

im not sure if its champion specific but the only ones i've played recently are Ahri {{champion:103}}  Sona {{champion:37}} and Lux {{champion:99}}

replies.body: Same thing happened to me, So glad that there was an older post with a simple solution.
same thing happens to me, and i tried to do the options you listed under the settings but it didnt work, i cast an ability and it goes of 2 seconds later, please help

Just to ensure this isn't a purely visual issue, can you hop into a custom match to check your in-game settings? Can you confirm that *Vertical Sync* under your **VIDEO** settings is enabled and that under **GAMEPLAY** you have *Movement Prediction* disabled?

Let me know if this caused any changes.
yes thank you very much i'd have never figured that out on my own. that semed to fix the problem thank you very much :)
